body_html:
I knew this. But this is not the error I mean. In numpy, svd is u * s *v, but tensorflow is u *s *v'.
…
在 2017年9月25日，16:15，Yaroslav Bulatov ***@***.***> 写道： Note that the latest version mentions the order difference @compatibility(numpy) Mostly equivalent to numpy.linalg.svd, except that the order of output arguments here is `s`, `u`, `v` when `compute_uv` is `True`, as opposed to `u`, `s`, `v` for numpy.linalg.svd. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. body_text:
I knew this. But this is not the error I mean.

In numpy, svd is u * s *v, but tensorflow is u *s *v'.
…
 在 2017年9月25日，16:15，Yaroslav Bulatov ***@***.***> 写道：

 Note that the latest version mentions the order difference

 @compatibility(numpy)
 Mostly equivalent to numpy.linalg.svd, except that the order of output
 arguments here is `s`, `u`, `v` when `compute_uv` is `True`, as opposed to
 `u`, `s`, `v` for numpy.linalg.svd.

 —

body:
I knew this. But this is not the error I mean. 

In numpy, svd is u * s *v, but tensorflow is u *s *v'. 

> 在 2017年9月25日，16:15，Yaroslav Bulatov <notifications@github.com> 写道：
> 
> Note that the latest version mentions the order difference
> 
> @compatibility(numpy)
> Mostly equivalent to numpy.linalg.svd, except that the order of output
> arguments here is `s`, `u`, `v` when `compute_uv` is `True`, as opposed to
> `u`, `s`, `v` for numpy.linalg.svd.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
>
